website_summaries.verdict: These Bear Paws are the original, must-have BBQ accessory. A favorite utensil of BBQ experts.
pros: Channel your inner grizzly bear with this shredding tool that acts like an extension of your arms
Lets you shred meats without getting burned or melting your tools
Better than using a traditional knife and fork to shred
Great for shredding all kinds of meat from turkey to beef
Ability to tear into a roast with simple efficiency,  and lift roasts off whatever cooking device you're using
Can use to help transfer meat from the smoker or oven to a resting surface
cons: Blades could get dull fast depending how often they are used
Better for larger pieces of meat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy with this product until I went to wash them and noticed after just one use the tips were already bent and warped. They weren’t even used in extreme temperatures considering they’re supposed to be heat resistant up to 475 degrees. Edited to add: I have reached out to the company who fulfilled the order and they stated the pair we got either was defective or somehow we received a knock off product. They're sending out a new pair and I hope I can update this review after we test out the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: I've heard some opinions of items like these that only serve one purpose in the kitchen ...
customer_reviews.text: I've heard some opinions of items like these that only serve one purpose in the kitchen being bad, but I think these claws are so much nicer than trying to tear apart a pork shoulder with a couple of forks. They seem pretty durable, but even with them being made of a tough nylon the tips will undoubtedly begin to bend and lose some of their sharpness. For the price though, I still prefer the surface area you gain over forks. They also really help transferring mead from the smoker or oven to a resting surface. Would definitely buy again when my current pair needs replacing.
customer_reviews.author: whereismymind

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend use of quality protective gloves for this task
customer_reviews.text: Works well with shredding, especially larger portions of meat, such a pork. Plastic appears to be of higher quality. Sufficient room in opening for most finger and hand sizes. Also noted is sufficient pointed tips at end of product that would not cause injury, unless careless. These points are needed to get the job started efficiently. Highly recommend use of quality protective gloves for this task. You are dealing with not only the mess of shredding itself but likely food item also has elevated temprature. That along with pointy tips of anything, foolish not to protect hands..
customer_reviews.author: Legardi11Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Significantly reduces the effort required for shredding!
customer_reviews.text: These work wonderfully! I originally purchased them because I was cooking for a group of 100+ on a trip. We made about 40lbs of shredded chicken thighs. Having made the same meal about a year prior, and spending a couple of hours shredding chicken with 2 kitchen forks, we knew there had to be an easier way! Using these shredding claws, we shredded 40lbs of thighs in about 45 minutes. There were 2 of us & we kept swapping put, because shredding still hurts your back/shoulders. But these claws are so sharp & useful that it took less than half the time! I've since used them to make shredded pork at home & they also work wonderfully for that!
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Kern

customer_reviews.title: The points get rounded. Buy metal.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great one time. Once you wash them and put them in a drawer, the points on the claws get rounded off easily. Recommend to purchase metal claws over these plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kiahuna Griller

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for bbq and smoking meats
customer_reviews.text: These are great tools for BARBQ and smoking meats. I use them frequently for picking roasts, tritips and other meats out of my Weber Smokey Mountain. They do a great job of digging into the hot meat when I transfer in/out of the smoker. I have also used them to shred a pork butt for pulled pork. They did an awesome job, but feel like they could make a model with the blades closer together for fine shredding. Cleaning them is a cinch, just drop them into the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Krappenschitz

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I love pulled pork and pulled chicken, and have no idea how I tolerated doing the work until I bought these. The traditional method is to use forks. However, they tend to trap shreds of meat between the tines, until you are "shredding" with two clumps of meat. These are sturdy and the tines are a bit further apart, so meat mostly just falls off. This means you can keep going and going until the job is done. Cleanup was easy. Scrape them off each other to get the useful pieces of meat off, then rinse and put in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Malodorous

customer_reviews.title: Won't Make You Look Like Wolverine
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I'm tired of supervillains attacking me when I'm in the kitchen. These actually work pretty well even though they look nothing like actual Wolverine claws. Which is good because when you strike a superhero stance and the bad guys are hampered with uncontrollable laughing it gives you an opening to swoop in and commence slicing. It's a good idea to carry a backup rolling pin in case you drop one of the claws.
customer_reviews.author: the Lumberjack

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not too crazy about these. They're probably great for HUGE cuts of meat, but for normal size pork and beef roasts (4 to 6 lbs) they're simply too large and unwieldy. And for pulled chicken, forget it! They're great grabbers I guess (roasts, birds, hams, etc.). Also, very sharp, use care.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shredding claws!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my boyfriend for Christmas. He loved them! They're super sharp, comfortable to hold (even for larger hands), and very well made. I ended up buying a knockoff pair for my uncle later on and regretted it. It's totally worth spending a few extra dollars to get the original version. They double as home defense too! Highly recommended! I'll buy a pair for someone else someday.
customer_reviews.author: LilDevil1828Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Mmmm, plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I just used these to shred some cold chicken. I washed them after and noticed the tips are starting to bend already. I thought one tip had piece on it from a towel, but on closer inspection, it is the plastic that has turned into a hard, fibrous-like thread. I checked all the bent tips and found more like this (and some without). I'm sure those missing plastic pieces are in the chicken, so I tossed it all.
customer_reviews.author: John Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Never Use Forks Again
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product that I never knew I needed. When slow cooking chicken or pork, I would generally take a wooden spatula to break off small chunks and use two forks to shred. This process took roughly 5-10 minutes, depending on size, of relatively strenuous work. Not with the claws though. First off, they make taking the meat out of the slow cooker super easy. They glide through the meat and rip it into shreds in a matter of seconds, and they're stupidly easy to clean. Plus, you can hold them and pretend to be a bear.
customer_reviews.author: NES

customer_reviews.title: Great on large cuts of meat not so easy on smaller cuts
customer_reviews.text: I only give this product a 4 star instead of 5 because when I first used it, it was hard to shred the tinier pieces of chicken when I removed them from my installer. This tool is phenomenal and glad I bought it but I would say it’s more for larger cuts of meat to shred and if you are looking for a super fine shred this will not provide that like a fork would but takes way longer. If you are using this on pork and brisket and large cuts of meat this is perfect no doubt. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: nico amarando

customer_reviews.title: Great claws
customer_reviews.text: These claws are awesome. I use to shred my pork roasts with two large serving forks, but after a few minutes, I had to stop and let my hands recover. These claws make the shredding so easy. They tear through and shred the meat very quickly with minimal effort. I have used them to shred pork butts and chickens. I was a bit concerned because they are all plastic, but that concern vanished quickly when I saw how well-made they are. I'm sure these will outlast me!
customer_reviews.author: SGP

customer_reviews.title: Sits in the drawer.
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit flimsy/plastic. Not as sturdy as we would have liked. Tried using it for pulled pork and other crock pot meals. Ended up just throwing it back in the drawer because it didn't really work as a shredder, which we intended when we purchased it. It does, however, work nicely to hold your meat while you cut it. But I prefer a large metal fork these days. Doesn't get used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I got these claws because I enjoy pulled pork and pulled chicken, but I always found forks didn't work well, and I usually ended up using my fingers. These claws shredded the meat very quickly and easily. I also tried using them for lifting hot chicken breasts from a crockpot. That didn't work so well, mainly because the tender chicken fell apart. I think that might work better with a larger cut of meat such as a pork shoulder. All in all, I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FinChase

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fighting bears and cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Multi-use tool right here. Tears the meat apart perfectly and great for carrying/moving the meat around without getting burned or dirty. On the flip side, throw these bad boys in your hiking bag and fight some bears along the way! Wouldn't advise bringing them to a street fight as its slightly necessary. You're welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended through a food magazine I bought. I fix pulled pork often for family get togethers. I also shred rotisserie chicken for certain recipes. All I can say is WOW! The tips of these shredders are extremely sharp and they cut through crock pot pork tenderloin like butter. I can't wait to try them on other types of food.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kundrat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for shredding meat...the right meat
customer_reviews.text: Do Not, I repeat DO NOT surprise your wife by wearing these and scratching down her back while she's wearing a flimsy tank top. She will yell, bend forward nearly hitting the pan of eggs she was scrambling for your breakfast and then turn around with near fire in her eyes ready to dole out the punishment you deserve. Do use these for all sorts of meats you would like to shred (I reiterate, the meat to shred is not located on your wife's back).
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great for chicken breasts
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been on a shredded chicken breast kick and were using table forks to do the shredding. It was a miserable task and we dreaded it but prefer the taste of shredded chicken over other cooking methods. I saw these in a newsfeed article on inexpensive things that will save you time. It seemed too good to be true but after quickly shredding 4 chicken breasts we have to say it definitely saves a lot of time and effort. I think they are actually intended for larger cuts of meat like roasts so are kind of bulky but worked really well on the chicken breasts. Life changing.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I saw these in a specialty store in the Smoky Mountains and I thought they were only there because of the bear theme, I had not ever seen them anywhere before. I bought them and immediately had to make BBQ Pork. They fit well on your hands, were really sharp on the ends and pulled the pork so smoothly, much better than using two forks. I even used them to mix in the BBQ sauce. They work so great! I bought two more pair from Amazon for my daughters for Christmas stockings! Shhh!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wykoff

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, tough, and crazy sharp!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty heavy duty. I am not sure how much I really needed them as I never get around to doing pulled pork that often as I plan. However, these things do the job and you can use them to pick up items. They are sharp as heck. As a matter of fact, it's my only negative about them. They are almost too sharp. If they sit in a drawer like mine, be careful and don't forget they are in there. I've had some "gotchas" with these. They are strong and wicked sharp. Should last a while if you are not ridiculous with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cosgringo

customer_reviews.title: Stop using forks!
customer_reviews.text: After trying to shred 8lbs of pork but with 2 forks, I went ahead and found these little guys. Did the other half of the but this weekend and used these guys this time. Shredding took 1/4 of the time and made a lot prettier presentation of the meat. It took a minute or two to get the hang of them, but then worked smoothly. With the meat cooked properly, I didn't need a knife or anything else--just a nice pile of pulled pork and clean bone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: We really like these bear claws when shredding smoked meat. They work great if you use your bare hands (no pun intended), however if you wear the silicone gloves while trying to shred the meat, it does become more challenging. Only complaint I have with cleaning is that the crevices are somewhat difficult to clean-again, nota deal breaker, but something I have noticed. Worth the buy if you smoke meat a lot!
customer_reviews.author: rlzakutansky

customer_reviews.title: Very well suited to making pulled pork and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used them for the first time on 6 pounds pulled pork and they made the job much faster and easier. Used them to take the cooked shoulder out of the foil to the cutting board without falling apart and the to take sections of the roast and pull it into the right sized pieces. This also made ir easy to pull the fat off so it was not part of the dish served to my guests. Got a nice email from them when I placed the order letting me know when the shipment would arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Stewart

customer_reviews.title: If you cook, you need these!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to shred pork shoulder for pulled pork. Used to shred chicken for the perfect chicken salad. Both worked great! It literally takes mere seconds to shred meat using these claws. These are the best meat claws you will find! I can’t recommend these enough! I assumed these would be metal without even reading. They are actually plastic. Have held up well so far. Have had them about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Review Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great product for shredding meat
customer_reviews.text: I had seen this product on a YouTube channel from a Cooking Channel and I decided to purchase it. This is a great product for shredding chicken, picking up meat, etc. It is very sharp though on the end so be careful when using it but you can put it in your dishwasher on the top rack to wash this product works really really great I was really amazed at how easy it shredded the chicken and the pork
customer_reviews.author: PepperminP

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning of the year I had a big family party and I asked my sister to help shred a pork roast. She asked where my meat shredders were. I vaguely recalled seeing something like these but hadn't ever thought about getting them. She told me she loved hers and uses them all the time but then I forgot about them. A few months went by and I was going to be shredding a couple of roasts later in the week and remembered that so I ordered these. They make the shredding easier and seem to be great quality to me. Nothing to complain about here.
customer_reviews.author: OnTheGoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Works but tips will bend
customer_reviews.text: So, I've seen some other reviews where the sharp points of the claws had bent down after a single use. When I got mine and started to pull some pork, I tried to do it as gently as possible BUT they still ended up bending at the tips. As long as they dont full apart at the ends and go into the food, I think they should be fine. The majority of the claws should still have enough strength to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Love these. The Bear Paws help pull pork faster and more consistently than any other method. I usually smoke my meat for 10-12 hours so there is no re-heating needed once it comes off the smoker. These bear paws protect my hands from getting burnt while pulling the pork and they are far more effective than forks. I pulled a 10lb butt in less than two minutes with these! I forgot to bring these to the last pig roast I was at. I am usually the butcher once the pig comes out of the smoker, and that was a huge difference not having these. Once you start using them, you will be amazed that you didn't have them much sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: Albo5000

customer_reviews.title: Not all that impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I am not much of a cook, so I am always trying to find different things to cook. I get tired of the same things over and over. Yes, chicken is chicken, but this is a different way of eating it at least. Well, when I went to use this it was a little difficulty for me. Didn't really like it all that much, but again....I am not much of a cook.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Texas Gal

customer_reviews.title: These paws are sharper than a grizzly bear’s claws.
customer_reviews.text: These claws will shred anything well cooked to pieces. Careful though, handle them carefully when using or washing them. Even when putting them away, they are sharp! They work perfectly and are tough. I suggest you shred always in bowl and concentrated on task. Don’t wash by hand, put in dishwasher, not worth the risk. As you may have noticed, too many close calls. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought these sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I always thought the "two forks" method was sufficient for shredding cooked meat, but I finally decided to try these to make shredding larger cuts go faster. These work great!!! And they also work for lifting a roast chicken out of the pan. They wash up well in the dishwasher (top rack) and are easy to store. My only regret is waiting so long to get these.
customer_reviews.author: BaMa

customer_reviews.title: love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE shredding chicken but LOVE having shredded fajita chicken and I saw these somewhere and decided to try them and I love them! I’ve used them several times as has my sister and we both love them. The “claws” SEEM to be wearing down a little bit which makes me nervous as I don’t want plastic in my food but it’s not enough that I would stop using them, and for all I know the part that looks like it’s wearing down is just the tip bending and it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Boomstra

customer_reviews.title: Much better than chopping
customer_reviews.text: I have always chopped my pork shoulders, but, at the suggestion of a friend, I wanted to try a pulling fork. After a quick search on Amazon, I purchased the Bear Claw. I used them once for pulling chicken breasts and once for a pork shoulder. I will never go back to chopping. This method of pulling pork is so easy and the meat comes out long and stringy and perfect for serving. Try it! you'll never use anything else to prepare pork or chicken.
customer_reviews.author: TNjoe

customer_reviews.title: Tips bent easily
customer_reviews.text: When I got these I loved them and the idea, but after 1 use and light handling, the tips have just become really bent up... I’m not sure if this would affect pulling pork, but it seems like it would. Kind of disappointed to say the least. Not sure if this happened in the dishwasher or just from pulling my first pork shoulder, but I am very gentle on things I use, so was quite surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Pogey B

customer_reviews.title: Not that useful
customer_reviews.text: I used these exclusively for about a year when I made pulled pork and I make a lot of pulled pork. I've gone back to tongs and a fork. There really isn't any advantage to using these, tongs and fork work better for me. Granted, they do have that coolness thing going for them and they're also good for disciplining the kids I guess so I'll leave it at 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: KBeagle

customer_reviews.title: Best meat shredder ever!
customer_reviews.text: My first order of Bear Paws was a couple of months ago. I have used them several times. First time I used them, I was fixing seven 5 lb pork roasts for a dinner. It took me less than 30 minutes to entirely shred all the roasts with the Bear Paws! They are so amazing, I am purchasing a pair for friends as Christmas gifts and for family members too! So much easier than using a fork!!! My favorite cooking tool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I shred chicken weekly as part of a diet for one of my dogs and I always used forks! How primitive LOL I've now upgraded to the bear claw! It is almost too sharp they work so well, they slide easily into the chicken and shred it right up. Just don't leave it laying on the stove like I did- the one end started to melt before I realized it 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Melsa

customer_reviews.title: Really sharp!  Does the Job - Quickly
customer_reviews.text: These are like an extension of your hand and they are really sharp! Great for shredding whatever meat you are grilling, roasting, baking and will do it in short order. Much faster than the usual fork. Need to pick it up - these have no problem penetrating the outer layer and moving that big turkey to the plate. Just store them away so you don't accidently injure yourself on the claws.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hustead

customer_reviews.title: Fast and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This product came in nicely packaged. Got tired of pulling pork apart the old fashioned way and so decided to look for a better way. After extensive searching and reading reviews, I decided to go with this one. Glad I did. Works like a charm and cleans up super fast too. If you're looking for something like this, pick this one. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Gift, looks good?
customer_reviews.text: got this as a gift for someone who has a smoker. looks pretty good. the box came a little bent, wasn't thrilled about that but meh. the price was pretty good, i think i may have gotten it during sale or something too. can't remember! the holidays flew by! They're pretty big though so probably a better guy gift as you need decently big hands for it to be comfortable, as a women who loves her meat i'm slightly offended by this, -_-J but they're not for me anyway so *shrug*
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Khaze

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for anyone that smokes or barbecues
customer_reviews.text: My daughter-in-law thought this was a great gift since my son uses his smoker every day. They’re using it for the first time this Sunday and she looks forward to having life a little easier for my son will use it to lift the roast in any other meat that they do out with those I think they’re going to really like them
customer_reviews.author: Am😊Susan vellone

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as metal claws
customer_reviews.text: I was initially concerned with these claws being plastic, worrying that they wouldn't be as sharp or able to withstand the heat. However, these are fantastic! They shred through meat effortlessly, being surprisingly sharp. When I first took them out of the package I almost pierced the skin on my finger, so watch out! These bad boys work great!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Trombley

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to use as expected
customer_reviews.text: I love the color. I bought the orange. However, they didn't shred our meat as easily as expected. It took more effort than using regular forks. I had to get my husband to finish pulling the meat. Even he didn't find it easier. Maybe we are doing the wrong technique. We will continue to try. They were easy to clean and the price was reasonable. Side note: my meats are so tender you don't need a knife. That's why we were surprised by the effort we had to put in.
customer_reviews.author: Deloris P.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Work, but Great Results
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot of work to pull pork, but pulled pork is way better than chopped pork. These are great. Experiment a bit and get your technique down. I pulled a whole Boston butt. Took me about a half hour, but it wasn't as tender as it could have been. If you've properly cooked low and slow, then it will be a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: FLAFarmer

customer_reviews.title: I think they can do the job!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were watching the Food Network and saw a guy using these for bbq. My husband said they were the neatest things and he would like to hair a pair. And now he will, Christmas morning. I asked around about these and no one really knew what I was talking about. I think they can do a lot of damage to a pork roast to create pulled pork. They look wicked and I am hoping that means that they do a good job and make short work of a rather tedious job.
customer_reviews.author: bg1

customer_reviews.title: Don't Wait Buy it Right NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this specifically for pulled pork barbecue. Oh my goodness what a difference these make. Shredded 7 pounds of bbq pork loin in about 5 minutes!!! I was standing there watching and just couldn't believe my eyes. Pork was hot but the claws kept your hands away from the heat. Super easy cleanup, just thrown them in the top rack of the dishwasher. My daughter says they are the S@#$!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie McClees

customer_reviews.title: Bear Paws?
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this as a gift, so I can't comment on function, but I can say that the product received was not the same as the product pictured. The box says Meat Claws, and there's no logo on the claws. It's misleading, but it might be the same product.
customer_reviews.author: jlt

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! Don't let the fact they are plastic fool you. The "fingers" are extremely sharp! I have to make sure to put them away in the drawer with the fingers pointing towards the back of the drawer. These are definitely not the item to let your kids help with though and should be treated like a sharp knife. They work amazingly well on beef or pork and chicken breasts but not chicken thighs. Thighs are more slippery and for me, the two fork method worked best for those.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Q

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend loved this gift!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is newly into smoking meats on his charcoal smoker and we've been acquiring all the smoker accessories we can. He saw that someone had these type of "claws" and wanted a set for himself, so I got him these as a stocking stuffer and he loves them! Already been put to good use a few times shredding pork butts and they work fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Bengalbunny

customer_reviews.title: Shred faster!
customer_reviews.text: I like to make chicken, but hate the process of shredding it with two forks. I couldn't bear (haha) it any longer because I bent my forks, and it took FOREVER! Well, no more! I've got these now, and I love 'em! They're effective, fun, and incredibly sharp. (As in don't get too carried away in the joy of shredding and accidentally shred your hand!) I definitely don't recommend these for giving a back massage, but they work wonders on meat in the crockpot!
customer_reviews.author: erinchilada

customer_reviews.title: High Priced but Effective
customer_reviews.text: These are made from thick and durable plastic, and the design is good. I tore through a 9 lb. smoked pork butt in just a few minutes. I'm thinking however that less expensive ones might have been just as effective, given that these will not get a lot of wear and tear in most households.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.R.

customer_reviews.title: Best I Ever Used. BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: Wow they are bug and strong enough for lifting heavy meats and easily shredding meat. The teeth are sturdier than any other shredders I've used before. Buy these some are a few dollars cheaper but they are several cooks of frustration due to lack of size and sturdy construction The teeth are super sharp strong and the handles are large enough for small or larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: Thaiville

customer_reviews.title: Made In USA and Really Shred Easily
customer_reviews.text: Great for shredding meat that you make in the Instant Pot or barbecue or any other method. Much better than trying to use two forks. My wrists/hands aren't very strong so these are perfect for me. There were similar products that were a bit cheaper but these are USA made so that tipped me to buying these and super happy. Very sharp so keep in the back of the drawer so you don't accidentally get stabbed.
customer_reviews.author: CurlyCaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but they're not great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my fiance to shred smoked meats. He first tried them on smoked whole chickens, without taking the meat off the bone first...which of course didn't work well. Once I removed the meat from the bone they shredded the chicken just fine. The reason for the two stars is because when we used these on a smoked pork shoulder the tips of all the claws started to bend a bit. They still worked fine for shredding but it caused the meat to get stuck to the claws even more. Somewhat disappointing to have the product show wear just after the second use.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee Greening

customer_reviews.title: They are alright
customer_reviews.text: So I randomly purchased these at work one day because I had nothing else to do. I've tried using them on different type of meats and I feel they are just ok. Its not an absolute necessity I actually do better with a fork. I do like that I can hold onto a meat and then cut with another utensil but overall they're just okay.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Meg

customer_reviews.title: Fun, funny, and work
customer_reviews.text: These are novelty, but I'm impressed with how well they work! They are awesome for picking up beef roast and shredding chicken for chicken tacos. I have huge hands for a woman and they fit. my sister in law with really small hands was able to use them and my bro with bigger hands was able to use them.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: A great gift
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift sent out of state directly from seller (BTW, gift wrapping would be nice), so I didn't actually get to see the product. However, my in-laws really claim to like them and are looking forward to grilling with them. They said they are high quality and easy to hold onto. Kinda want to try a set ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: The Bookie

customer_reviews.title: Bear Claws does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for pulled pork and beef briskets, which we like to smoke using our electric box smoker, "low and slow". We ordered these from Amazon and they arrived quickly. I took them out of the package and showed them to my wife, who said "What are those for?". My wife quickly realized they could be used for "pulling" pork, and also realized she could use these for handling roasts and turkeys. We kept the original package for storing these claws, because they are too sharp to just leave in a drawer unprotected.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy8703

customer_reviews.title: Ordered orange and got the original.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the orange colored claws and they arrived as the item advertised. I've read that some people have received knockoffs so I just wanted to clarify that I received the original BEAR PAWS product as advertised. Haven't used them yet, so can't comment on their performance except to say that they hold firmly in the hand and look like they will pull a pork shoulder with little problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Great size and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a Christmas present for my father, who is an avid barbecuer. The product seems to be fantastic, very durable, easy to hold (for both myself and my much larger dad), and they're dishwasher safe. However when I opened the Amazon box, the actual package for the claws had been torn open at the top. I doubt a person opened the package, but rather the Amazon box it was placed in was not large enough and it opened through shipping. Overall I'm very satisfied with the purchase and am very excited for my dad to use them!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: If you love pulled pork, you need these.
customer_reviews.text: It makes shredding meat a LOT faster and more consistent. My husband's hands were getting tired doing this with forks, so we surprised him with Bear Claws and he was very happy (and our 5-year-old son was psyched to give them to him!). Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren LaCorte

customer_reviews.title: Not better than using two forks.
customer_reviews.text: Not much better than just using two forks. I hate using two forks and bought these to try. Good quality, they're closed in the back. I've seen some review where people received knock-offs that were open in the back. That would be awful for sanitation and cleanup. These are completely solid. But still not that much better than just using forks.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Short

customer_reviews.title: I feel like wolverine!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these pork shredders as I love to smoke boston butts. In the past I have used two forks to shred the pork and it worked, but took a while and aggravated an injury I have to my thumb. The Bear Paws worked wonders. I felt like wolverine using them! The pork was shredded in no time and no pain in my thumbs. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Toddman24

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Gotta admit that I was skeptical about these when I pulled them out of my stocking this past Christmas, but they really work! They were a little uncomfortable, but I think that’s because I put the cooked chicken in a big bowl and then shredded it in there. They have crazy sharp points! Thanks Santa!!
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Makes meat easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after seeing my parents use it - especially great for pulling apart cooked pork when it's hot! Made the pork come apart like butter. I also plan on using it to shred chicken. Super easy to use and pretty easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hulse

customer_reviews.title: The Kitchen Tool You Just Can't Live Without!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Bear Paws I have purchased; the first pair was for the old guy here and I was so impressed, I bought a second pair for my Daughter and Son-In-Law. We use the Bear Paws for so many things around the kitchen above and beyond making short work of shredding chicken, beef and pork incredibly easy and fast. I have lifted a 26 pound turkey with the Paws. This is one kitchen/grill tool you have to have. Thanks to the inventor of Bear Paws for making food prep so much more fast and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for BBQs and shredding chicken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. My sistersister-in-law was the first to use it though. Hahaha. She needed to shred the pork for pulled pork sandwiches. When she was done she said, "These are cool. That was way easier than using forks. I felt like a badger or bear!" I used it to shred chicken for enchiladas and it was easy to use. I don't let the kids wash this because it doesn't LOOK sharp but it can slash through things with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle D

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I had always shredded meat with forks all my life. Everyone has forks, its simple enough. These things completely changed my opinion on that. You can tear through meat while holding these claws like you're the next wolverine in training. Fun to use and the meat gets shredded!
customer_reviews.author: Jesi

customer_reviews.title: VERY sharp - work great
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these and felt how lightweight they were, I figured they wouldn't be very good. These buggers are SHARP and make quick work of shredding meat. You gotta be very careful when washing them that you don't stab yourself or tear new holes in your washcloth....speaking from experience.
customer_reviews.author: NJW

customer_reviews.title: Shreds like a boss
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I smoke meats almost weekly. A favorite for us is pork butts. But if you've ever tried to shred pork butts with a fork you know how tedious that can be. Not anymore :) These claws are very sharp - so be careful. They really did make quick work of shredding a very large butt. Originally I bought them as a gag gift thinking they wouldn't work, but they do and they are now a household staple.
customer_reviews.author: Micole Copas

customer_reviews.title: Easy grip, pulls in a lot shorter time than ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not know how I lived without this! Even though the pork butt is tender enough to pull apart with a couple of big salad forks there is no comparison. Easy grip, pulls in a lot shorter time than with forks or other kitchen utensils. Like my dad always told me, "you have the right tool for the job you get it done quick and makes it a lot easier on you." And for the record, this is the right tool for pulling pork. My only regret is that I did not get this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rigney

customer_reviews.title: Great for bbq & smoking
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool, makes it easier to move around pieces of meat that are too hot for hands and too big for utensils. Like a helping set of hands. Was great to move the turkey from a roasting pan to a serving platter when the forks and tongs just wouldn't cut it. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shillingburg

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: WOW! These work really well, super sharp! The backsides are solid, with the grip area has a waffle type underside so it doesn't get slick from juices. I recommend putting these "tools" up or hiding them, away from the normal plastic utensil drawer...if a child gets hold of these, it can be all bad. I put mine in the dishwasher, top rack, accidentally hit the point while taking them out..great self defense weapon too
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: We love these! They are easy to use and clean. I do wish the claw sections were a little closer together, so the meat shredded into smaller pieces. However, this is an excellent gift for a man who loves to cook and has everything! Better than using regular forks, as I did before these.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Never a let down!
customer_reviews.text: These are the shizzzz! I cooked a whole pork butt in my Insta-pot that makes it super tender & juicy. These pulled the meat apart in 10 minutes or less! I highly recommend this product! Don't waste your money on the cheaper brands. These are heat resistant and grippy. Also... if you go camping take these with you to ward off the bears! Lol They are super sharp too!
customer_reviews.author: CHERBEAR23

customer_reviews.title: These are absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been pulling pork and chicken with 2 forks and/or my hands, which usually left my wrists hurting. I ordered the bear paws in hopes that it would help and that they would do a half way decent job. Well to my surprise not only did the bear paws make it easier on my wrists they do an AMAZING job of pulling pork and chicken. It took me probably 5 mins to pull an entire 5 lb pork shoulder. These things are incredible and I have nothing but good things to say about these. Plus when you pick them up you cant help but feel like wolverine (that's just and added bonus). HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Asinofsky

customer_reviews.title: Large forks work better and are much easier to hold.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Not ergonomic. Don’t understand all the rave reviews. Very difficult to hold. The claw part should be angled down more or the handle should be angled up. I think maybe a post would work better than a handle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever make shredded beef without these things?
customer_reviews.text: These "bear claws" make short order of preparing shredded beef. Once cooked in the Instant Pot, I use these to shred the meat up. It also makes it super-easy to pull out excess fat and gristle that might be there. Easy to use and clean. Be careful though - the ends are sharp! Treat like a knife.
customer_reviews.author: John Wolnisty

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Easily rips apart the pork - I used to do this with forks. These claws make it so much easier and faster. I pressure cooked twelve 6# pork shoulders and had to shred them for a large dinner. So easy! It was also nice to use the claws to lift the pork out of the pot. You don't even need 2 of them to shred. When two of us were shredding, we each had a claw and held the pork with a fork - worked just great.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great Shredders!
customer_reviews.text: I received these shredder claws and used them the next day when I shredded cooked chicken breasts! They are easy to hold but a word of caution; they are very sharp so be very careful and be sure to store in a protective manner and away from children. They do a great job and I look forward to using when I want to shred a pork shoulder! I have been using two forks which is time consuming as well as difficult! I recommend these Bear Paws Shredder Claws!
customer_reviews.author: 2dogs

customer_reviews.title: We love the bear claw meat shredders
customer_reviews.text: These meet all my expectations. We BBQ several days a week and have pulled pork or pulled chicken every week. These work so fast and make the job so easy and your hands never get overheated. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Must have for kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all of our life? I have watched my husband for years try to make pulled pork when it’s screening hot this make that job super easy. I just used them last night for bbq chicken sandwiches - it makes it so easy to pull them apart.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Bears, Eats, Delicious Pulled Pork
customer_reviews.text: After smoking a nice chunk of pork for 20 hours, these claws are perfect for pulling apart that delicious tender meat. Best part for me? They are dishwasher safe so you can just toss them in a walk away. So much easier than trying to use 2 forks to shred the pork! Extremely happy with my purchase thus far!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: My daughter prefers shredded meat in casseroles. Have only used this once and it is a lot easier to shred ham that it is to do so with two forks. It also arrived very promptly . Didn’t comment on stretch or heat resistant because that’s not soynething I have experience with. I wanted something that shredded meat easily and it seems to do just that so I’m pleased!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RJ Simpson

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these once so far, but I love love love them. I shredded chicken breasts with speed and ease. Kinda makes me want to do a pulled pork roast asap to see how that does! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gblaize

customer_reviews.title: It's plastic
customer_reviews.text: They seem pretty sturdy but the tip of the claw is really thin and gives the impression it won't stay sharp long. I thought this was made from metal but it's actually plastic. It doesn't feel as sturdy as expected.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't wait to get these. A friend of mine had something similar, but these are so much better quality than hers. They are very durable and very sharp. I am so pleased with how these work and would recommend them to anyone. Perfect for roast, shredding and even turkey dinner. Can't wait to use them throughout summer cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Smuckers

customer_reviews.title: Makes shredding fast and failproof
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how large these are when I received them. I didn't open them for a few days, because I thought I would be returning them. Then I opened them and fell in love. They do a great job keeping your hands away from the hot meat. They shred to perfect sizes, no more "mushy" over shredded meat in our house. And they are easy to clean. They are SUPER sharp and definitely need out of reach of the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: dtro

customer_reviews.title: Pulled Pork must haves
customer_reviews.text: These are the next best thing to sliced bread when it comes to pulling pulled pork shoulder apart, which is mostly what I have used it on, but also shredding chicken. They are quite sharp! Okay, sliced bread would not manage to pull pork shoulder apart at all, so that is a silly metaphor. But seriously, these things work. Anyone who smokes or grills pork shoulders, or any meats and shreds or pulls them ought to own these. They also work well for picking up large roasts, think turkey at Thanksgiving, out of the roasting pan to the platter.
customer_reviews.author: Moniva

customer_reviews.title: Kinda early to tell but...
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived slightly opened. I taped it back closed as it's part of a gift. Cannot testify as to use, quality seemed ok. Bigger than expected. Hard plastic. Not sure if it's worth the ten bucks but we'll see. Will update if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: The shredding can begin...
customer_reviews.text: Got these to help with my pulled pork and they are awesome! Light but sturdy and are sharp enough to get the job done with no problems. I even pretended to be Wolverine but the kids are too smart for me and pointed out he only has 3 claws on each fist so I grounded them both and ate all the pulled pork myself. Okay, I gave them some, I'm not that mean. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Alan James Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Bear Paws
customer_reviews.text: These things are SHARP! and easily tear through meat. We always joke that we are glad they are "safety orange" because you could hurt yourself on them sticking your hand into a drawer. Must have for meat eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these claws! Shredding meat has been difficult with my hands that have little strength. Now I can shred a pot or pork roast with ease. I put them in the top rack of the dishwasher and I’m good to go. I high recommend these claws, it makes life easier
customer_reviews.author: Marquis40

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If you cook a lot with a crock pot or pressure cooker these are really nice to have. While they won’t get you a really fine shred like a fork they make quick work of stuff and keep your hand off hot food. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are EXTREMELY big, way to big for a drawer or to shred chicken breasts. Not for the average person. A fork works much better. I didn’t return them because my husband likes the concept. But in all reality... a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: New favorite kitchen utensil!
customer_reviews.text: These make shredding meat SO much easier than forks!!! I can not believe it took me so long to get a pair! I didn’t want to spend the $$ when forks work just fine, but I had to make pulled pork for 20+ people and decided to take the leap, and boy am I glad I did! These cut the shred time in half!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley K

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: These are so much easier than trying to pull pork with two forks and having your hands cramp up. They work beautifully and wash very nicely. One tip: I wrapped mine in a cloth and placed in a Ziploc bag ... I was concerned that someone might stab their hand if I left them loose in the utensil drawer. They are very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: For bigger hands
customer_reviews.text: These are easy for my hubby to use. I dont know if its cause I have small hands, but they're a bit awkward for me. I prefer to shred with two forks. Seems safer too because these are insanely sharp. Would recommend for someone with bigger hands.
customer_reviews.author: PreciousCargo4

product_meta.title: The Original Bear Paws Shredder Claws - Easily Lift, Handle, Shred, and Cut Meats - Essential for BBQ Pros - Ultra-Sharp Blades and Heat Resistant Nylon
product_meta.description: Color:BlackBear Paws are the original, must-have BBQ accessory. A longtime favorite of BBQ experts across the nation, Bear Paws are specially designed for lifting and shredding meat. Channel your inner grizzly with the only meat shredding tool that fits your hands perfectly, acting as an extension of your arms and allowing you to shred meat without getting burned or melting your tools. The super-sharp, meat-shredding –claws” are strategically spaced so meat wonêt get stuck. Bear Paws offer a much better way to shred meat than the traditional knife and fork. Thanks to super-strong nylon construction, which is much harder and stronger than plastic, Bear Paws are heat-resistant up to 475 degrees, so you never have to worry about them melting from the heat of your meat. Bear Paws are BPA-free for safe food handling. Each Paw is made of a single piece of hard nylon, so there arenêt tiny pieces to disassemble and wash by hand. In fact, Bear Paws are dishwasher safe on the top rack, making for the easiest cleanup ever. Youêll never run out of uses for your Bear Paws. Originally designed as the perfect tool for pulling pork, Bear Paws are also ideal for lifting and shredding chicken, brisket, beef, pork, turkey, or whatever else suits your fancy on the grill. Theyêre great for tossing salads and even handy as turkey lifters. Bear Paws are the best accessory for your grill, smoker, or kitchen, and they make great gifts for BBQ fanatics. Experience the best with Bear Paws. Weêve been named The Best BBQ Tool by the National BBQ Association, and have been featured on TV on BBQ Pitmasters, Americaês Test Kitchen, and Guy Fieriês Dinerês, Drive-Ins, and Dives. Bear Paws are 100% made in the USA and we proudly sponsor BBQ competitions and events across the country. For a reputation that canêt be beaten, go with the REAL Bear Paws.
feature_bullets: TIME SAVER - Bear Paws are the answer to perfectly shredded meat without the mess and headache of knives and forks. Easily grasp and shred pork, chicken, beef, and more with the ultra-sharp –claws.”
MELTPROOF and DISHWASHER SAFE - Made of BPA-free nylon and heat-resistant up to 475 degrees. Never worry about your shredding tools melting near the grill or in the dishwasher.

EASY & FUN TO USE - Lift, handle, shred, pull, and carve to your heartês content. Excellent as turkey lifters, too! Our unique design gives you a perfect handhold for safely managing the super-sharp shredding blades.
BBQ PRO FAVORITE - Featured on BBQ Pitmasters, Guy Fieriês Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives, and Americaês Test Kitchen. Bear Paws have been named –Best BBQ Tool” by the National BBQ Association.
THE ORIGINAL BEAR PAWS - The favorite BBQ accessory for years, Bear Paws are 100% made in the USA. Nobody beats us for quality and strength. We know Bear Paws will make your BBQs 100% more epic.
